snippet: The biggest pension fund in the Netherlands, Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds, said on Tuesday that it had divested its stakes in Wal-Mart Stores and PetroChina and blacklisted both companies in its portfolio, citing noncompliance with United...
abstract: The biggest pension fund in the Netherlands, Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds, said on Tuesday that it had divested its stakes in Wal-Mart Stores and PetroChina and blacklisted both companies in its portfolio, citing noncompliance with United Nations human rights principles, according to MarketWatch.
lead_paragraph: The biggest pension fund in the Netherlands, Algemeen Burgerlijk Pensioenfonds, said on Tuesday that it had divested its stakes in Wal-Mart Stores and PetroChina and blacklisted both companies in its portfolio, citing noncompliance with United Nations human rights principles, according to MarketWatch. Read more »

headline.main: Big Dutch Fund Dumps Wal-Mart and PetroChina

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Human Rights and Human Rights Violations
